communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request for Data on School Policing (Holbrook Police Department)
communications.communication:
I have attached the MOU pertaining to question #3.  We have had no arrests at the Holbrook Public Schools for the period of time you inquired about.  There was only one SRO for the timeframe you are inquiring about.  I would normally not know how many guidance counselors there are but I asked the SRO and he replied that there are two of them.  I would not have a record of how many if any, calls came through our 911 System. You would need to inquire with the Communications Department for that information.  The School’s SRO is not paid by them, he is paid through the Police Department.  Just for a point of information, the Police Department has Officer Blue and he goes to School every day with the main SRO and he is our comfort dog.  Attached please find a spreadsheet of information for the “referral” aspect of the request.  The SRO produced this for me whereas he is directly in contact as being the “referral” person. Today is the 10th business day from the request date.  We made the original goal without needing the extension of time.  I believe this concludes our end of the “Public Records Request” that you submitted.  Stay safe!

Debora A. Hoyte

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request - Business Insider (University of Tennessee, Knoxville)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all guidelines, protocols, training materials, educational materials, and screening or diagnostic materials used by the university’s athletics department related to the prevention of disordered eating, identification of student-athletes at risk of developing disordered eating, and establishing a chain of reporting for a student-athlete flagged as at risk for developing or exhibiting symptoms of disordered eating.

Relevant keywords to this records search include anorexia nervosa, bulimia nervosa, binge-eating disorder, relative energy deficiency, low energy availability, RED-S, and disordered eating.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Hannah Beckler.

Records mentioning or describing Sumner Redstone, whose death has been widely reported. See  Sumner Redstone, Towering Media Mogul Who Helped Shape Modern Entertainment Industry, Dies at 97  in Variety https://variety.com/2020/tv/news/sumner-redstone-dead-97-viacom-cbs-paramount-1234732722/

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: eFOIPA Authorization Request
communications.communication:
You have successfully requested access to FBI's eFOIPA website.

Please access the efoia.fbi.gov by following this temporary authorization url:
<https://efoia.fbi.gov/authorize/326cb7eed13b36666c775f096a63e3f593c5c629>.

communications.subject: eFOIA Request Received
communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am requesting a fee waiver for my request and have reviewed the FOIA
reference guide. If my fee waiver is denied, I would like to limit my request
to the two free hours of searching and 100 duplicated pages.

# Proof Of Affiliation for Fee Waiver

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have
    previously written
    about the government and its activities, with some reaching over 100,000
    readers in outlets such
    as Gizmodo, MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the People, Unicorn Riot, and
    The Outline,
    among others. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and
    my editorial and
    writing skills are well established. In addition, I discuss and comment on
    the files online and
    make them available through non-profits such as the library Internet Archive
    and the journalist
    non-profit MuckRock, disseminating them to a large audience. While my
    research is not limited
    to this, a great deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and
    attitudes of the government
    itself. As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of
    this particular subject in
    advance.
    Further, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the
    released information to a
    broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch, Inc. v.
    Dep’t of Justice, 365
    F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of Justice, 19 F.
    3d 807, 814-15 (2d
    Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified because it also had
    “firm” plans to “publish a
    number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning United States foreign and
    national security policy."
    Under this criteria, as well, I qualify as a member of the news media.
    Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the
    nature of the requester,
    not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made by” a
    representative of the news
    media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper reporter, for example, is a
    representative of the
    news media regardless of how much interest there is in the story for which
    he or she is requesting
    information." As such, the details of the request itself are moot for the
    purposes of determining
    the appropriate fee category.
    As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting
    on it and making
    the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.
    This request specifically includes both previously processed and previously
    unprocessed
    documents. If the documents are 25 or more years old and previously
    processed documents were
    processed before the 25th anniversary of the document’s creation, I request
    that in addition to the
    previous processed copy, the document be reprocessed and redactions
    reviewed.

Documentation Files

# Deceased Individual

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix ARN SSN FBI Number Date of
Birth Place of Birth Date of Death Additional Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    Records mentioning or describing Sumner Redstone, whose death has been
    widely reported. See Sumner Redstone, Towering Media Mogul Who Helped Shape
    Modern Entertainment Industry, Dies at 97 in Variety
    https://variety.com/2020/tv/news/sumner-redstone-dead-97-viacom-cbs-paramount-1234732722/
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Emma Best
    
    Attachments:
    
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/EmmaBest/87594/Fee20category20and20search20parameters.pdf
    Upload documents directly:
    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fsumner-redstone-100859%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAj2MnNxOre1oSHteLnfMK20oc%3A1k644t%3A1Wry7IbOYFxeD9utpbxURxLIlzk

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Walter Mondale (FBI)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all files, reports, background information, memos, directives, investigatory materials, communications and any other attachments and relevant materials regarding Walter Frederick Mondale, who served as the 42nd Vice President of the United States. Please include all materials gathered in reference to him during his lifetime, including those processed during political campaigns, etc. Please include all materials in any tangential or cross-reference databases (active or defunct), in addition to those materials found in the Central Records System.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Benjamin Gartner

    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me

    Sincerely,
    
    Benjamin Gartner
    
    Upload documents directly:
    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fwalter-mondale-fbi-112338%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2DhBAMB3M81TmD2Oe8C8-1M%3A1lfxwV%3AdZ_J5gab97A9XiM2nYSoN8mk_1k

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1496418-000
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 152 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 922 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,964 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Additional DOCCS Ethics Disclosures
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any statements of financial disclosure -- including but in no way limited to supporting documentation, such as exhibits; notices of delinquency; notices of civil assessments; terms of settlements of complaints or referrals that include a fine, penalty, or other remedy; records required to be made publicly available under the Lobbying Act; and Substantial Basis Investigation Reports issued by the Commission on Ethics -- filed between 2010 and 2015 for the following individuals:

- BobyJoe Fosmire, Department of Corrections and Community Supervision
- Catherine Martuscello, Department of Corrections and Community Supervision

Any statements of financial disclosure -- including but in no way limited to supporting documentation, such as exhibits; notices of delinquency; notices of civil assessments; terms of settlements of complaints or referrals that include a fine, penalty, or other remedy; records required to be made publicly available under the Lobbying Act; and Substantial Basis Investigation Reports issued by the Commission on Ethics -- for the following individuals, filed during the entirety of their civil service:

 - Judith Byrnes, Department of Corrections and Community Supervision

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

communications.subject: FW: Webform submission from: Records Request
communications.communication:
Mr. Gelardi

The Commission has received your January 22, 2024 request seeking “Any statements of financial disclosure -- including but in no way limited to supporting documentation, such as exhibits; notices of delinquency; notices of civil assessments; terms of settlements of complaints or referrals that include a fine, penalty, or other remedy; records required to be made publicly available under the Lobbying Act; and Substantial Basis Investigation Reports issued by the Commission on Ethics -- filed between 2010 and 2015 for the following individuals:

- BobyJoe Fosmire, Department of Corrections and Community Supervision
- Catherine Martuscello, Department of Corrections and Community Supervision

Any statements of financial disclosure -- including but in no way limited to supporting documentation, such as exhibits; notices of delinquency; notices of civil assessments; terms of settlements of complaints or referrals that include a fine, penalty, or other remedy; records required to be made publicly available under the Lobbying Act; and Substantial Basis Investigation Reports issued by the Commission on Ethics -- for the following individuals, filed during the entirety of their civil service:

- Judith Byrnes, Department of Corrections and Community Supervision.”

The Commission expects to respond to your request on or before February 25, 2024.

Sincerely,

Records Access Officer

communications.subject: FW: Webform submission from: Records Request
communications.communication:
Mr. Gelardi,


Attached are the records responsive to your January 22, 2024 FOIL request seeking, “Any statements of financial disclosure -- including but in no way limited to supporting documentation, such as exhibits; notices of delinquency; notices of civil assessments; terms of settlements of complaints or referrals that include a fine, penalty, or other remedy; records required to be made publicly available under the Lobbying Act; and Substantial Basis Investigation Reports issued by the Commission on Ethics -- filed between 2010 and 2015 for the following individuals:

- BobyJoe Fosmire, Department of Corrections and Community Supervision
- Catherine Martuscello, Department of Corrections and Community Supervision

Any statements of financial disclosure -- including but in no way limited to supporting documentation, such as exhibits; notices of delinquency; notices of civil assessments; terms of settlements of complaints or referrals that include a fine, penalty, or other remedy; records required to be made publicly available under the Lobbying Act; and Substantial Basis Investigation Reports issued by the Commission on Ethics -- for the following individuals, filed during the entirety of their civil service:

- Judith Byrnes, Department of Corrections and Community Supervision.”



Portions of the documents are redacted as it contains information which if disclosed would constitute an unwarranted invasion into the individual’s personal privacy and is therefore exempt from disclosure pursuant to Public Officers Law Article 6 Section 87(2)(b).

 Please note the following:

Notices of delinquency for Financial Disclosure Statements are available for public viewing here: https://ethics.ny.gov/view-delinquent-filings-financial-disclosure-statements

Information on final investigations enforcement actions are available to the public here: https://ethics.ny.gov/enforcement-actions

Records required to be made publicly available under the Lobbying Act can be found using the Commission’s Public Search Query: https://reports.ethics.ny.gov/publicquery

Due to the Commission’s retention schedule, the records for years 2010-2015 are not possessed or maintained by the Commission. Pursuant to Public Officers Law §89 (3)(a), an agency is not required to prepare any record it neither possesses nor maintains.

You have 30 days to appeal this response. You may send your appeal to:

Appeals Officer
540 Broadway
Albany, NY 12207
records@ethics.ny.gov<mailto:records@ethics.ny.gov>

Sincerely,

Records Access Officer

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Julian Assasnge Charges
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide any and all documents /case files and any charges pertaining to Julian Assange DOB: July 3, 1971. And confirm if there is a criminal case and any pending criminal charges against this individual. If there are not any criminal charges pending against this individual, then his hold in Prison at Belmarsh in London, at the request of the United States Government is a violation of the United States Constitution and an unlawful detainment of a foreign citizen.

There should not be any fees to fulfill my request. Please send all documents via email.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mason C. Turner

communications.communication:

The first is a copy of the email transmission, sent on December 6, 2023, from this Office to your email address, in which we provided the final response to your FOIA request assigned administrative tracking number FOIA-2024-00421. communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: 11-01 forms from November, 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Copies of the individual 11-01 forms from November 01, 2023 to November 30, 2023.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend.

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

12/20/2023 

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR156165 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014613-121923 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(x) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
() there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request. 

Sincerely, 

Patricia Majchrowicz 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools 
Please note that District Offices will be closed from Monday, December 25th through Monday, January 1st.

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N014613-121923
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
February 2, 2024 Miriam Bhimani RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014613-121923 Dear Miriam Bhimani: This letter is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking the following information: 
Copies of the individual 11-01 forms from November 01, 2023 to November 30, 2023. RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your FOIA request are available to download via the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. Please visit the following link and enter your username and password to access the records: http://cps.edu/About_CPS/Departments/Law/Pages/FOIARequest.aspx . Be advised that charter schools are included. Portions of the information have been redacted to protect identifiable student information included within the records. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5(r) in accordance with Illinois Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA prohibits the disclosure of “school student records” and defines a “school student record” as “any writing or other recorded information concerning a student and by which a student may be individually identified, maintained by a school or at its direction or by an employee of a school, regardless of how or where the information is stored. 105 ILCS 10/(d): Release of a minor’s record may only be authorized by the parent or guardian in accordance with the Illinois student Records Act (105 ILCS 10/1 et seq.). To the extent you consider this a denial of your request, you have the right to challenge this response under 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a) by filing a request for review with the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at: Public Access Counselor; Office of the Attorney General; 500 South 2nd Street; Springfield, IL 62706 . You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court, 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Thank you for your request. Sincerely, Ana Diaz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
February 2, 2024 Miriam Bhimani Re: Chicago Public Schools (CPS) FOIA Request N014618-121923 Dear Miriam Bhimani: This letter is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking the following information: 
Anonymized data of all school assignment requests made on behalf of CPS students with IEPs requiring placement from July 01, 2023 to September 30, 2023. These records should include a unique non-identifiable code for the student, the date their IEP was finalized, the date the school assignment request was made, the date the school assignment letter was issued, and the date the student enrolled. 
RESPONSE: Data reflecting some, but not all, of the information sought in this part of your request is available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. The FOIA office has been advised by the CPS Office of Diverse Learners Supports and Services that it does not maintain any single system or database that comprehensively tracks each datapoint listed in this portion of your request. The raw data being provided reflects the date of assignment requests made and the date of assignments being finalized. In order to respond to this portion of your request fully, the District would be required to first analyze individual IEP and assignment records and then cross-reference them with enrollment records in order to create a brand-new dataset. That new dataset would then have to be anonymized. Please note that the Illinois Freedom of Information Act applies only to existing records that a public body has chosen to create and maintain in the normal course of its business. It does not require the District to prepare or create records that did not exist at the time the request was made. [5 ILCS 140/1] Accordingly, the District has no further records responsive to your request. To the extent you consider this a denial of your request, pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a) you may file a Request for Review with the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at: Public Access Counselor; Office of the Attorney General; 500 South 2nd Street; Springfield, IL 62706 . You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court; 5 ILCS 140/11.  Thank you for your request. Sincerely, Ana Diaz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

title: City of Aliso Viejo Transparency and Audit

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: City of Aliso Viejo Transparency and Audit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

(1)	Copy of all credit card statements for all city issued credit cards between January 1, 2009 to present. 

(2)	All documents without limitation including contracts, contract amendments, emails, correspondence, invoices or bills concerning the Orange County Sheriffs Department at any time.

(3)	All contracts, contract amendments, emails, correspondence, invoices or bills concerning Orange County Sheriffs Department between January 1, 2009 to present. 

(4)	All City Attorney Contracts and all amendments between January 2009 to present.

(5)	All City Attorney resignation letters.

(6)	All City Attorney invoices between January 2009 to present.

(7)	A copy of the City of Aliso Viejo business license for each City Attorney law firm contracted by the City of Aliso Viejo between January 2008 to present.

(8 ) All City Administrator/City Manager/Interim City Manager/administrator contracts and all amendments between January 2009 to present, and all resignation letters.

(9)  A copy of all public records act requests made between January 1, 2009 to present

(10) Between January 2015 to present, a copy of all emails from all city email accounts assigned to the following: all city council members, city managers/city administrators, interim city managers/interim city administrators, planning director. 

(11)  A record of all mileage payments made between January 1, 2009 to present.

(12)  A copy of all invoices, bills, or receipts, and payments for catering and entertainment between January 1, 2009 to present, including but not limited to the December 2015 council celebration. 

(13)  All correspondence to/from the Orange CountyDistrict Attorney’s office, including but not limited to correspondence related to alleged Brown Act open meeting violations.

(14)  All documents, including emails, related to the appointment of the “planning director” referred to in the State Auditors report, which may include but are not limited to, notice of personnel action or notice of appointment, signed oaths of office pursuant to Government Code section 3102, new employee orientation or enrollment, correspondence or enrollment with CalPERS.

(15)  Any document providing the names of all current City of Aliso Viejo employees; and a copy of each employee oath of office pursuant to Government Code section 3102.

(16)  All records of ethics training, including but not limited to AB1234 training, of all council members after January 1, 2008.

(17) All correspondence between the City of Aliso Viejo and the California State Controller between January 1, 2009 to present. 

(18  ) All correspondence between the City of Aliso Viejo and  the California Public Employees Retirement System (CalPERS) between January 1, 2009 to present. 

(19) All correspondence between the City of Aliso Viejo and the Insurance Authority between January 1, 2007 to present.

(20) A copy of all contracts, contract amendments with Republic Services between 2000 to present. 

(21)  All annual Fair Political Practices Commission disclosure reports for all Council members and city employees filed between January 2009 to present.  

(22) A copy of all City contractors/vendors lists between January 2009 to present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

September Baron

September Baron

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: City of Aliso Viejo Transparency and Audit
communications.communication:
Hi,

In accordance with established municipal protocols, it is imperative to expedite the production and submission of your bond as City Clerk. It is a requisite that the City Clerk's bond be duly filed with the Office of the Mayor. The current delay in the presentation of your bond raises substantial concerns. Under the prevailing municipal regulations, the absence of a properly executed and filed bond disqualifies an individual from holding the office of City Clerk. Persisting in occupying this position without the requisite bond may be construed as an unauthorized assumption of office, an act which carries serious legal implications. Immediate attention to this matter is strongly advised to ensure compliance with relevant statutory requirements and to uphold the integrity of the office.

Thank you

September Baron

Sent from [Proton Mail](https://proton.me/mail/home) for iOS

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: City of Aliso Viejo Transparency and Audit
communications.communication:
Hi,

It has come to my attention that a misunderstanding has arisen due to a lack of telephonic communication between us, attributed to your decision to terminate the call prematurely. As the appointed City Clerk, it is incumbent upon you to adhere to the principles and responsibilities enshrined in your oath of office, which fundamentally obligates you to serve the public interest. This role inherently positions you as a servant to the constituents you are sworn to serve, thereby establishing a relationship where the constituents are, in effect, the principals in this dynamic.

The premature termination of our call not only raises concerns regarding your commitment to these obligations but also poses a potential jeopardy to your tenure in office. It is imperative to highlight the necessity of immediate accessibility to the surety bonds, which, as per legal requirement, must be maintained on file for all city officials at all times. Failure to promptly furnish these documents upon request could potentially expose you, and by extension, the entire City Council, to significant legal repercussions.

It is critical to underscore that the operational framework of municipal governance, including the requirement for surety bonds, is grounded in the Constitution of the United States. This foundational document supersedes any state laws to the contrary, ensuring that no deviation from its mandates is permissible. The insistence on accessing these bonds is not subject to discretionary delay and must be addressed forthwith.

Any attempt to rationalize a delay or non-compliance is unacceptable and necessitates immediate scrutiny. Should there be any failure to comply with these constitutional requirements, it may be requisite to bring this matter to the attention of higher judicial authorities, including the Supreme Court, to review the practices of the City of Aliso Viejo. Such actions are necessary to ensure adherence to the constitutional directives governing the conduct and obligations of city officials at all levels.

Respectfully,
September Baron

Sent from [Proton Mail](https://proton.me/mail/home) for iOS

communications.subject: RE: Clarification and Expansion of Ongoing Public Records Request
communications.communication:
Dear Mitzi,

I am writing to address a matter concerning the same letter I received nearly two years ago, which pertains to my public records request. I am perplexed as to why this letter was referenced in response to my recent inquiry for all city officials' oaths and bonds. My understanding is that there is no limitation on the number of public records requests I am entitled to submit. Therefore, I seek to clarify and expand my current request under the relevant public records law.

Moreover, I wish to express my concerns regarding the prolonged period it has taken to fulfill my existing request, which has now extended over a year and a half. Given this delay, I believe it is within my rights to amend my request to include additional documents, specifically the bonds of all city officials and sheriff’s. Which was not part of my original submission. In my original request #15 is where I’ve requested all city officials Oaths.

I would like to formally request that the aforementioned documents included. It is my hope that this matter can be resolved promptly and efficiently, in accordance with the law governing public records requests.

Respectfully,
September Baron

Sent from [Proton Mail](https://proton.me/mail/home) for iOS

communications.subject: Re: Fw: RE: California Public Records Act Request: City of Aliso Viejo Transparency and Audit
communications.communication:
September Baron

Sent from [Proton Mail](https://proton.me/mail/home) for iOS

"On Thu, Feb 1, 2024 at 3:34 PM, September <septemberbaron@protonmail.com> wrote:
Good afternoon, 

I am hereby transmitting the correspondence previously engaged with the municipal clerk for your scrutiny. As as a long-standing resident of Aliso Viejo since its foundation.  I have the right to inform you that its imperative, given your tenure that you be apprised of these exchanges and the grave concerns they encapsulate, which could potentially implicate the entire City Council of Aliso Viejo.

It is essential to acknowledge the illicit conduct currently permeating our city, notably involving personnel from the local sheriff's department. I urge you to consider the gravity of my assertions with utmost seriousness, as any further disregard for my petitions may precipitate severe legal consequences for the municipality, including yourself as the Mayor. My prior attempts to communicate through voicemail and email have been met with an unsettling silence, devoid of any recognition or response. This lack of engagement does not befit the responsibilities assumed by those who have pledged to serve the public interest.

The refusal of the city council to engage with the citizenry, who provide the financial support for their positions, starkly contradicts the ethos of public service. As the Mayor and other municipal officials, you have sworn an oath to serve— a commitment I, as a citizen, have not undertaken. This oath entails a duty to the populace, a duty flagrantly breached when my attempts to exercise my constitutional rights are dismissed or ignored by city staff, including the receptionist and the city clerk.

Therefore, I demand immediate action to address these concerns, which not only merit but may necessitate judicial scrutiny at the highest level, including potential review by the Supreme Court, to assess the city's adherence to the Constitution of the United States of America.

Respectfully, 
September Baron


September Baron


Sent from Proton Mail for iOS"

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: City of Aliso Viejo Transparency and Audit
communications.communication:
September Baron

Sent from [Proton Mail](https://proton.me/mail/home) for iOS

"On Wed, Jan 31, 2024 at 4:08 PM, September <septemberbaron@protonmail.com> wrote:











Hi Mitzi, 

I want us to both be on the same page I have requested in writing the bond information for the all sheriffs deputies under a contract with the city bond information as well as all elected officials bond information. 

In your response email you related to me that The city is not holding any of the bonds for the contracted sheriffs, and or you aren’t in possession of them. You’ve also stated that the city officials don’t have to furnish their bond upon an individuals request.

Is this correct as far as my understanding in your response, email? 

I appreciate your clarification. 

Respectfully, 


September Baron


Sent from Proton Mail for iOS


On Wed, Jan 31, 2024 at 11:22 AM, Mitzi Ortiz <mortiz@AVCity.org> wrote:
Good morning Ms. Baron,

 

The listed documents were not part of your initial request for records; however, I have provided the responsive documents as attachments to this email.  Please note that the City Council is not required to furnish a bond, therefore there are no responsive records to that portion of your request.  Also, the records relating to deputy sheriffs must be requested directly from Orange County.

 

Regards,

 

Mitzi Ortiz | Director of Government Services"

It is essential to acknowledge the illicit conduct currently permeating our city, notably involving personnel from the local sheriff's department. I urge you to consider the gravity of my assertions with utmost seriousness, as any further disregard for my petitions may precipitate severe legal consequences for the municipality, including yourself as the Mayor. Therefore, I demand immediate action to address these concerns, which not only merit but may necessitate judicial scrutiny at the highest level, including potential review by the Supreme Court, to assess the city's adherence to the Constitution of the United States of America.

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Brandon Nodier Police Investigative Report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Police reports, investigative records and arrest report for Brandon Nodier, date of birth January 1 1954, arrested in April 2012 at the St. Bernard Sheriff's Office in Chalmette and charged with the murder of Dorothy Thompson, 63, on May 2, 1985.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mikita Brottman

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Homeless Deaths Within Clark County
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) A list of all individuals processed who did not have a permanent address at the time of death (homeless individuals) 
(2) Autopsy records and coroner's notes of previously stated individuals

I am looking for a time period of 2018-2022

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelsea Frobes

communications.subject: RE: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Homeless Deaths Within Clark County
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Nevada Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Oct. 18, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

Attached is information you requested from the Clark County Office of the Coroner/Medical Examiner. Please note this list will only include cases where the decedent has been identified and their legal next of kin has been notified. It is important to note that this report is based on preliminary information received by the Office of the Coroner/Medical Examiner and will only include deaths the coroner’s office investigated in which we could not identify a place of residence for the decedent. For this reason, the report could include individuals who were not homeless. Also, this report does not include deaths that were not investigated by the coroner’s office. For example, a homeless individual who was hospitalized for some time before his or her death, and so was under the care of a doctor, would not be on this list. You may want to check with the Southern Nevada Health District if you haven’t done so already to see what additional data it may be able to provide. Additionally, your request for autopsy records of all individuals who passed away from 2018-2022, poses significant challenges for our office. It would entail staff having to manually pull over a thousand reports and then redacting confidential information that is not subject to state public records laws. Such a request would take us many months to process. Please let me know if the attached information satisfies your request. If there are some specific cases you are interested in receiving more information about, please let me know which ones and I will check with the Coroner’s Office on an estimated time to provide the records and any related costs.

title: Amazon inland empire (Office Of The City Manager)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Amazon inland empire (Office Of The City Manager)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports show that Amazon has been active in the Inland Empire and among Inland Empire public agencies: https://www.latimes.com/business/story/2023-12-05/leaked-document-offers-glimpse-into-how-amazon-amasses-influence-in-the-inland-empire

https://twitter.com/LorenaSGonzalez/status/1732047860701782381/photo/4

Therefore, I hereby request the following records:

1) All presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other information presented to the city/agency by Amazon 

2) A copy of any incident reports relating to Amazon, including attachments and media.

3) Any emails between the city/district and Amazon employees, including attachments and media. Please limit search to between Jan 1, 2023 and the time this request is processed

4) Any grants, gifts, contracts, between this agency and Amazon

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jason Koebler

communications.subject: California Public Records Request :: W015043-121023
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of December 10, 2023, Reference # W015043-121023 
Dear Jason, 
The Public Records Advocate received the below records request from you on December 10, 2023. To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Public reports show that Amazon has been active in the Inland Empire and among Inland Empire public agencies: https://www.latimes.com/business/story/2023-12-05/leaked-document-offers-glimpse-into-how-amazon-amasses-influence-in-the-inland-empire 

https://twitter.com/LorenaSGonzalez/status/1732047860701782381/photo/4 

Therefore, I hereby request the following records: 

1) All presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other information presented to the city/agency by Amazon 

2) A copy of any incident reports relating to Amazon, including attachments and media. 

3) Any emails between the city/district and Amazon employees, including attachments and media. Please limit search to between Jan 1, 2023 and the time this request is processed 

4) Any grants, gifts, contracts, between this agency and Amazon 

Responsive records from Finance and Fire Prevention are available via the Riverside Records Portal. To view your request please click here. 
Per the Fire Department, the City of Riverside Fire Department has found 40 incident reports related to your request. Incident reports are not subject to public disclosure. Enclosed is a spreadsheet with the data for these incidents. If you would like to request the incident reports please go to our website www.riversideca.gov/fire and find the “Request for Incident Report” under the forms and resources. The request form can be sent to prev@riversideca.gov. There is a fee of $5.35 for each report requested and private citizen information will be redacted from the reports. Additionally, please note that many of these are vehicle related accidents in the area of and may not be directly associated with Amazon, rather the Fire Department was dispatched to the vicinity of an Amazon facility. Please call (574) 339-3629 if you have any questions. 
There are no responsive records pertaining to item 1. 
The Riverside Police Department has no responsive records pertaining to item 2. 
The Clerk's Office is in the process of obtaining email results to fulfill item 3 of your request.  Once email results are received, the results will be evaluated to determine whether any exemption applies.  A rolling disclosure will begin no later than January 19, 2024, and will continue thereafter until all non-exempt records with or without redactions have been disclosed in accordance with the Public Records Act. 
If you have any questions, or wish to discuss this further, please contact me. 
Sincerely, 
Carmen Soto 
City Clerk’s Office 
(951) 826-5557 CSoto@riversideca.gov (mailto:CSoto@riversideca.gov)

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of December 10, 2023, Reference # W015043-121023 
Dear Jason, 
Responsive email records are available via the Riverside Records Portal. To view your request please click here. 
Attachments to emails that contain system architecture diagrams and system security configurations have been deleted because they are privileged and therefore exempt from disclosure pursuant to Government Code Section 7929.210 Law section (ca.gov).  However, the body of the email is responsive and has been provided. 
This concludes our response to your request for public records. If you have any questions, or wish to discuss this further, please contact me. 
Sincerely, 
Carmen Soto 
City Clerk’s Office

title: Purchase records and 'less lethal' use records (Modesto Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Purchase records and 'less lethal' use records (Modesto Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Purchase records, invoices, procurement documents and other documents sufficient to show any and all disbursement of public funds for the acquisition by your agency since July 1, 2015 of any of the following:
• Firearms of .50 caliber or greater
• Patrol rifles (as commonly denominated for law enforcement use) or assault rifles (as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the California Penal Code)
• Wheeled vehicles that are built or modified to provide ballistic protection to their occupants, such as Bearcats or armored personnel carriers.
• Projectile launch platforms, such as 40mm projectile launchers, "bean bag" or specialty impact munition ("SIM") weapons, and "riot guns" used to disperse chemical agents
• Long-Range Acoustic Device (LRAD)

2. Purchase records, invoices, procurement documents and other documents sufficient to show any and all disbursement of public funds for the acquisition by your agency since July 1, 2018 of explosives and pyrotechnics, such as "flash bang" grenades and explosive breaching tools, and chemical weapons such as "teargas" and "pepper balls".

3. Records of deployment by your agency since January 1, 2020 of projectile launch platforms, such as 40mm projectile launchers, "bean bag" or specialty impact munition ("SIM") weapons, and "riot guns" used to disperse chemical agents; explosives and pyrotechnics, such as "flashbang" grenades and explosive breaching tools; and chemical weapons such as "teargas" and "pepper balls".

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

If you would like to discuss this request, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, American Friends Service Committee, at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Purchase records and 'less lethal' use records (Modesto Police Department)
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Gallagher,

Please forgive my delay in replying to your November 2 response (attached) to my Pubic Records Act request. I was considering how best to respond.

Regarding #3 of my request, which was for deployment records, we understand that "deployment" may be defined differently in different contexts. We are seeking records of when the equipment was brought out into the public or in an operation (i.e., not for training). 

We also understand that some agencies only keep records of such deployment when there is a use of force involved, in which case any other type of deployment would have a "no responsive records" finding. 

Regarding #1 and #2 of my request, which were for purchase records of certain equipment used by Modesto PD, I would like to amend my request to seek the following:
Inventory records of equipment in Modesto PD's possession, if any, for the following types of equipment, for which new state legislation requires publication of information:

(1) Unmanned, remotely piloted, powered aerial or ground vehicles.
(2) Mine-resistant ambush-protected (MRAP) vehicles or armored personnel carriers. However, police versions of standard consumer vehicles are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(3) High mobility multipurpose wheeled vehicles (HMMWV), commonly referred to as Humvees, two and one-half-ton trucks, five-ton trucks, or wheeled vehicles that have a breaching or entry apparatus attached. However, unarmored all-terrain vehicles (ATVs) and motorized dirt bikes are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(4) Tracked armored vehicles that provide ballistic protection to their occupants and utilize a tracked system instead of wheels for forward motion.
(5) Command and control vehicles that are either built or modified to facilitate the operational control and direction of public safety units.
(6) Weaponized aircraft, vessels, or vehicles of any kind.
(7) Battering rams, slugs, and breaching apparatuses that are explosive in nature. However, items designed to remove a lock, such as bolt cutters, or a handheld ram designed to be operated by one person, are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(8) Firearms of .50 caliber or greater. However, standard issue shotguns are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(9) Ammunition of .50 caliber or greater. However, standard issue shotgun ammunition is specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(10) Specialized firearms and ammunition of less than .50 caliber, including assault weapons as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code, with the exception of standard issue service weapons and ammunition of less than .50 caliber that are issued to officers, agents, or employees of a law enforcement agency or a state agency.
(11) Any firearm or firearm accessory that is designed to launch explosive projectiles.
(12) “Flashbang” grenades and explosive breaching tools, “tear gas,” and “pepper balls,” excluding standard, service-issued handheld pepper spray.
(13) Taser Shockwave, microwave weapons, water cannons, and the Long Range Acoustic Device (LRAD).
(14) The following projectile launch platforms and their associated munitions: 40mm projectile launchers, “bean bag,” rubber bullet, and specialty impact munition (SIM) weapons.

Please include equipment that may be assigned to or designated for use by special units or jails.

Please note that the above list of types of equipment is taken verbatim from legislation enacted on September 30, 2021 (AB 481, see https://leginfo.legislature.ca.gov/faces/billNavClient.xhtml?bill_id=202120220AB481). This legislation will require all police departments and sheriff offices in California to publish use policies by May 1, 2022 that include, for each type of equipment named above that the agency has acquired and seeks to continue to use, "a description of each type of military equipment, the quantity [acquired], its capabilities, expected lifespan, and product descriptions from the manufacturer of the military equipment." The legislation requires that agencies publish this information on their web sites and submit the information to local city councils or boards of supervisors.

In other words, the legislature has determined that information on the number and description of these articles possessed by law enforcement agencies in California is not exempt from disclosure under the California Public Records Act. While responding to this request may require some staff time, we understand that AB 481 will require this and other work from the department in the coming months. 

I appreciate your efforts in response to this request. 

best,
John Lindsay-Poland

Dear Ms. Gallagher,

Thank you so much for your response. I appreciate it.

Regarding inventory records for Item #10, your staff requested clarification. This refers to "assault rifles as defined in Sections 30510 and 301515 of the Penal Code." These are typically referred to by law enforcement as "patrol rifles". 

Please let me know if you need further clarification. 

best,
John Lindsay-Poland
510-282-8983

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Purchase records and 'less lethal' use records (Modesto Police Department)
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Gallagher,

I am following up on my email of Jan. 22, 2022 regarding my PRA request of October 12, 2021 for inventory records or information for a number of types of equipment owned by Modesto PD. In your Jan. 21, 2022 response, there was a request for clarification regarding the portion of my request that dealt with patrol rifles (or assault rifles as defined by California law). I responded with a clarification on Jan. 22. I have not received a response to this portion of my request since then. 

I attach the City's Jan. 21, 2022 response and below is my response to the request for clarification.

Can you let me know by when the City will response to this portion of my request?

Thanks so much.

John Lindsay-Poland


Jan. 22 email:
Dear Ms. Gallagher,

Thank you so much for your response. I appreciate it.

Regarding inventory records for Item #10, your staff requested clarification. This refers to "assault rifles as defined in Sections 30510 and 301515 of the Penal Code." These are typically referred to by law enforcement as "patrol rifles".

Please let me know if you need further clarification.

best,
John Lindsay-Poland
510-282-8983

communications.subject: Public Records Request
communications.communication:
Good Morning, I received your follow up request regarding a request that was handled by Pamela Gallagher prior. She has since retired. To confirm, you are just looking for the information requested in item #10?

Heidi D. Jenkins
Police Civilian Manager
Modesto Police Department, Support Division
(209) 572-9692, jenkinsh@modestopd.com<mailto:jenkinsh@modestopd.com>
[New Star and Patch]

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Purchase records and 'less lethal' use records (Modesto Police Department)
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Jenkins:

Yes, I was seeking followup only on #10 of the Jan. 21, 2022 response. And to further clarify, we are seeking records regarding all patrol rifles (or assault rifles as defined by California law), regardless of whether the Department categorizes them as standard issue.

Thanks much in advance for your assistance with this request. If you need any clarification, feel free to reach out to me by phone at 510-282-8983 or email at jlindsay-poland@afsc.org.

best,
John Lindsay-Poland.

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Purchase records and 'less lethal' use records (Modesto Police Department)
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon, please see attached response as requested.

Heidi D. Jenkins
Police Civilian Manager
Modesto Police Department, Support Division
(209) 572-9692, jenkinsh@modestopd.com<mailto:jenkinsh@modestopd.com>
[New Star and Patch]

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: CPRA Request: CopLink
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents that were active between 1/1/2018 and 1/9/2024 with Forensic Logic or SoundThinking for the use of CopLink or CrimeTracer.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Your City of Modesto CA public records request #24-20 has been opened.
communications.communication:
City of Modesto CA ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-20 has been submitted successfully. Please be advised that City of Modesto has received your California Public Records Act request. Your request will be processed in compliance with the Public Records Act. Pursuant to California Government Code § 7922.535, the City shall, within 10 days from receipt of the request, determine whether the request, in whole or in part, will be made available and shall promptly notify the person making the request of the determination and the reasons therefore. In certain circumstances, the time limit prescribed in this section may be extended by written notice to the person making the request, setting forth the reasons for the extension and the date on which a determination is expected to be dispatched. Please note that you will be contacted when the information is available. All document duplication fees are due and payable in full and are based on the City’s current fee resolution. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Modesto CA.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: [External Message Added] City of Modesto CA public records request #24-20
communications.communication:
City of Modesto CA ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #24-20: The City of Modesto would like to inform you that a 14-day extension is necessary under Gov. Code section 7922.535(c)(3). The City has the need: * To consult with another agency having substantial interest in the request (such as a state agency), or among two or more components of the local agency (such as two city departments) with substantial interest in the request; ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Modesto CA.
Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: [Document Released] City of Modesto CA public records request #24-20
communications.communication:
City of Modesto CA ************************************************************************ Documents have been released for record request #24-20 along with the following message: Dear Requester: This email is in response to your written request for public records received by the City. We are treating your request as a request for public records in accordance with California Government Code Section 7920.000 and following (the California Public Records Act, or “the Act”). The Act requires that public agencies make reasonably identified, non-exempt public records available for inspection or provide copies upon payment of the direct costs of duplication. The City is required to notify you within ten (10) days whether the requested records will be disclosed. (Gov. Code section 7922.535(a)). On January 22nd, the City notified you that we would need an additional 14 days to respond pursuant to Government Code section 7922.535(b). This response fulfills the City’s obligations under the Act. Responsive, non-exempt public records have been recovered, and are attached. This completes the City’s response to this public records request.  * RESO 2023-218.pdf * MODESTO 2ND AMENDMENT - Signed.pdf * PO 182397.pdf * First Amendment to the Master Services Agreement.pdf * Executed Master Service Agreement.pdf Document links are valid for one month. After March 1, you will need to sign in to view the document(s). ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Modesto CA.
Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Gator
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Emails written, sent, or received by any employee of the New York City Parks Department between February 18, 2023 and the date this request is processed which contain any of the following non-case sensitive keywords in the body or header:
-Gator
-Alligator
-Godzilla
-Prospect Park Lake

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jake Offenhartz

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request #FOIL-2023-846-00125
communications.communication:
Hi Rupali, 

I was reaching out to discuss the above note. My understanding is that it is not normally necessary to specify the exact employees. However, maybe it would be easier to narrow the search if I specified that, for now, I'm looking for any communications using the keywords "Gator" or "Alligator" between Parks Department employees  and employees of the Wildlife Conservation Society, including but not limited to: Max Pulsinelli (mpulsinelli@wcs.org); 
Mary Dixon (mdixon@wcs.org); Cristián Samper (csamper@wcs.org); Caleb McClennen (cmcclennen@wcs.org); and Jim Breheny (jbreheny@wcs.org). 

I'm also interested in any communications using the keywords "Gator" or "Alligator" between the Parks Department and any members of the Prospect Park Alliance, whose emails end in "@prospectpark.org". It is not necessary to upload these responses together -- whichever comes out first is fine. 

Finally, the time period I'm looking for here is February 18th to the date the request is filed. 

Thanks,
Jake

914 500 3940

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Inquiry about FOIL-2023-846-00125
communications.communication:
Good morning,

This message is to update you on your Freedom of Information Law ("FOIL") request submitted to the New York City Department of Parks & Recreation ("Parks"). Parks is still examining our records to determine whether we possess the requested information and, if so, the extent to which it is available for disclosure under the Freedom of Information Law. Please be advised that due to the volume of FOIL requests our office processes, Parks needs additional time, approximately sixty (60) business days (approximately June 8, 2023) from the date of this message, to respond to your request.

Best Regards,
Mark

Mark McCormack, CPRP (he / him / his)
Risk Management and Legal Records Officer
Office of the General Counsel

T 212.360.8141
F 917.849.6754
E Mark.McCormack@parks.nyc.gov

Please note: My work days are Tuesday/Wednesday/Thursday

NYC Parks
The Arsenal, Central Park
830 Fifth Avenue, Room 313
New York, NY 10065

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: SY23, N2: Parent Restriction Letters
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show copies of Parent Restriction letters issued from July 1, 2022 - June 30, 2023 for the following schools/instances:

1. Any district-wide issued letters;
2. Any letters issued by schools in Network Two:
BRENNEMANN
CHAPPELL
COONLEY
COURTENAY
DECATUR
DISNEY
FIELD
GALE
GOUDY
HAYT
JAMIESON
JORDAN
KILMER
MCCUTCHEON
MCPHERSON
MOSAIC
NEW FIELD
RAVENSWOOD
STONE
SWIFT
WATERS

These may also be listed as "Violation of Visitor Protocol" letters. Please note that I am not seeking any personally identifiable information or otherwise exempt information. As required by the statute, please ensure that the requested documents are redacted rather than exempting the entirety of the document. Additionally, for any and all exemptions used to redact exempt information, please provide clear and convincing evidence for each exemption used by your agency. 

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

12/18/2023 

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR155990 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014595-121723 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(x) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
() there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request. 

Sincerely, 

Patricia Majchrowicz 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools 
Please note that District Offices will be closed from Monday, December 25th through Monday, January 1st.
